maml:description.maml:para: The Get-AzureRmPeering cmdlet gets the Peerings of the subscription, resource group, or specific Peering name.

maml:Description.maml:para: The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Shows all Peering resource by Kind
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Shows all Peering resource by Kind
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Shows all Peering resource by Kind

command:example.maml:title: -------- Example 1: Get Peering for Subscriptions --------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-AzureRmPeering Sku : Microsoft.Azure.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Peering.Common.Models.PSPeeringSku Kind : Direct Properties : Microsoft.Azure.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Peering.Common.Models.PSPeeringProperties Name : Contoso0Peeringbldg41 Id : /subscriptions/XXXXXXX-61c4-436f-XXXX-XXXXXXXXX/resourceGroups/Contoso0/providers/Microsoft.Peering/in terconnects/Contoso0Peeringbldg41 Type : Microsoft.Peering/Peerings Location :LAX ETag : Tags : {}
Sku : Microsoft.Azure.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Peering.Common.Models.PSPeeringSku Kind : Direct Properties : Microsoft.Azure.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Peering.Common.Models.PSPeeringProperties Name : Contoso1Peeringbldg40 Id : /subscriptions/XXXXXXX-61c4-436f-XXXX-XXXXXXXXX/resourceGroups/Contoso1/providers/Microsoft.Peering/in terconnects/Contoso1Peeringbldg40 Type : Microsoft.Peering/Peerings Location :SEA ETag : Tags : {}

command:example.maml:title: -------- Example 2: Get Peering for Resource Group --------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmPeering -ResourceGroupName Contoso1 Sku : Microsoft.Azure.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Peering.Common.Models.PSPeeringSku Kind : Direct Properties : Microsoft.Azure.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Peering.Common.Models.PSPeeringProperties Name : Contoso1Peeringbldg40 Id : /subscriptions/XXXXXXX-61c4-436f-XXXX-XXXXXXXXX/resourceGroups/Contoso1/providers/Microsoft.Peering/in terconnects/Contoso1Peeringbldg40 Type : Microsoft.Peering/Peerings Location :SEA ETag : Tags : {}

command:example.maml:title: ------------- Example 3: Get Peering details -------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmPeering -Name MyTinyPeering -ResourceGroupName rg0 Sku : Microsoft.Azure.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Peering.Common.Models.PSPeeringSku Kind : Direct Properties : Microsoft.Azure.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Peering.Common.Models.PSPeeringProperties Name : MyTinyPeering Id : /subscriptions/XXXXXXX-61c4-436f-XXXX-XXXXXXXXX/resourceGroups/Contoso1/providers/Microsoft.Peering/in terconnects/MyTinyPeering Type : Microsoft.Peering/Peerings Location :SEA ETag : Tags : {}

maml:description.maml:para: Gets Bandwidth offers avaliable for a subscription. Applies to both Direct and Partner Peering.
The Get-AzureRmPeeringBandwidthOffer cmdlet gets bandwidth offers for the subscription.

maml:Description.maml:para: The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Bandwidth offer. Omit to return all offers
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Bandwidth offer. Omit to return all offers

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmPeeringBandwidthOffer -ResourceGroupName rg0 -PeeringName MyPeering list of offers

maml:description.maml:para: Get the Carriers for the subscription
The Get-AzureRmPeeringService cmdlet gets the Carriers of the subscription.

maml:Description.maml:para: The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Lists all Carriers avaliable to subscription.

maml:description.maml:para: Get a list of legact peerings with Microsoft that can be converted to Direct Peering Resources.
Use Get-AzureRmPeeringLegacyDirectPeering cmdlet to convert legacy objects to new Direct Peering objects.

maml:Description.maml:para: The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2: --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmPeeringLegacyDirectPeering | foreach {New-AzureRmPeering -Name $_.Properties.PeeringLocation.Insert(0,"Peering") -ResourceGroupName rg0 -DeviceLocation $_.Properties.PeeringLocation -SkuName $_.Sku.Name -Tier $_.Sku.Tier -Family $_.Sku.Family -Size $_.Sku.Size -DeviceName Rapter1,Rapter2 -coloId 1ed,2ed -rackId a,b -portId 1,2,3,4,5 -SessionIPv4Prefix $_.Properties.Direct.ADeviceSession.SessionIPv4Prefix,$_.Properties.Direct.BDeviceSession.SessionIPv4Prefix -SessionIPv6Prefix $_.Properties.Direct.ADeviceSession.SessionIPv6Prefix,$_.Properties.Direct.BDeviceSession.SessionIPv6Prefix -Bandwidth $_.Properties.Direct.BandwidthInGpbs -AsJob -Force}

dev:remarks.maml:para: Converts all existing Legacy Direct Peerings into Peering objects.

maml:description.maml:para: The Get-AzureRmPeeringLocation cmdlet gets locations of Peerings

command:example.maml:title: --------------------- Direct Peering ---------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-AzureRmPeering -PeeringName Contoso1_SEA_Peering -ResourceGroupName Contoso1 -PeeringLocation $location[0].Properties.PeeringLocation -SKU premium_Direct_Unlimited -DeviceAName Rapter1 -UseForPeeringService -DeviceAColoId ef4 -DeviceARackId 12c -DeviceAPortId xe0/0/0 -DeviceASessionIPv4Prefix 192.168.10.2/31 -DeviceASessionIPv6Prefix fe00::e024/126 -DeviceBName Rapter2 -DeviceBColoId rd5 -DeviceBRackId 13b -DeviceBPortId xe0/0/1 -DeviceBSessionIPv4Prefix 10.2.24.99/30 -DeviceBSessionIPv6Prefix fe01::34fd/127 -BandwidthInMbps 10000 Sku : Microsoft.Azure.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Peering.Common.Models.PSPeeringSku Kind : Direct Properties : Microsoft.Azure.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Peering.Common.Models.PSPeeringProperties Name : Contoso1_SEA_Peering Id : /subscriptions/XXXXXXX-61c4-436f-XXXX-XXXXXXXXX/resourceGroups/Contoso1/providers/Microsoft.Peering/in terconnects/Contoso1_SEA_Peering Type : Microsoft.Peering/Peerings Location :PeeringLocation_Building40 ETag : Tags : {}

dev:remarks.maml:para: Location must be a location returned by the command Get-AzureRmPeeringLocation. You can store this as a variable $location = Get-AzureRmPeering
